title: Pomerantz Law Firm Announces the Filing of a Class Action Against Tesla, Inc. and Certain Officers - TSLA
text: NEW YORK , Oct. 3, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Pomerantz LLP announces that a class action lawsuit has been filed against Tesla, Inc.  ("Tesla" or the "Company") (NASDAQ: TSLA) and certain officers.   The class action, filed in the United States District Court for the Western District of Texas, and docketed under 25-cv-01213, is on behalf of a class consisting of all persons and entities other than Defendants that purchased or otherwise acquired Tesla securities between April 19, 2023 and June 22, 2025, both dates inclusive (the "Class Period"), seeking to recover damages caused by Defendants' violations of the federal securities laws and to pursue remedies under Sections 10(b) and 20(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and Rule 10b-5 promulgated thereunder, against the Company and certain of its top officials.

title: Tesla: From Bear To Believer - A Deep Dive Into The $1T Compensation Plan
text: I was dead wrong with my bear case on Tesla, Inc. Focus is shifting from poor EV sales and slow robotaxi deployment towards the approval of CEO Elon Musk's $1T compensation plan. The plan (granted on September 3, but pending approval) grants up to 423.7M shares in 12 tranches, each tied to market cap and operational milestones. The final market cap target is $8.5T. Reaching that valuation hinges on Optimus. Elon says it's 80% of future value. At 25% margins and a 25 P/E, Tesla would need $1T revenue from ~36–54M robots/year.

From Q4 onwards, Tesla's future ventures won't offset core EV weakness in the near term; robotaxi and FSD progress are limited, and the Optimus humanoid is years from mass rollout.

title: Tesla Earnings Show Its Core Business Is Struggling
text: Tesla, Inc.'s financials are deteriorating, with declining revenues, margins, and free cash flow, signaling the company is no longer a growth story. Inventory build-up, weak Cybertruck demand, and questionable future mass-market vehicle prospects highlight operational and competitive challenges. AI and robotaxi ambitions face technological, regulatory, and competitive headwinds, while CEO Elon Musk's focus and political risks further cloud the outlook.

title: Tesla: Q2 Performance Brought The Company From Bad To Worse

Competition is intensifying, especially from BYD Company in Europe and China, while Tesla's production lags behind its capacity and market share erodes. TSLA stock valuation remains extremely lofty, with high P/E and P/FCF multiples unjustified by current business performance or cash flow trends.

title: Bad Quarter, Big Vision: Tesla's Worst Metrics Hide The AI Supercycle Unleash
text: Tesla's Q2 2025 results offer a mixed bag, though the core structural growth drivers are still intact. We got fresh momentum in long-term growth bets, but also a few red flags that warrant caution in the near term. For the quarter, revenue slid 12% from a year ago to $22.5 billion, with the drop in vehicle deliveries and softer selling prices across the board. Gross margin came in at 17.2% - down 71 basis points. Operating margin took a bigger hit, down to 4.1% from 6.3%. Free cash flow was down a staggering 89% year-over-year, landing at just $146 million. That's a steep drop and puts near-term earnings power under strain.

title: Tesla, Inc. (TSLA) Q1 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
text: Tesla, Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA ) Q1 2025 Earnings Conference Call April 22, 2025 5:30 PM ET Company Participants Travis Axelrod - Head of IR Elon Musk - CEO Vaibhav Taneja - CFO Ashok Elluswamy - Director, Autopilot Software Lars Moravy - VP, Vehicle Engineering Karn Budhiraj - VP, Supply Chain Conference Call Participants Pierre Ferragu - New Street Emmanuel Rosner - Wolfe Edison Yu - Deutsche Bank George Gianarikas - Canaccord Colin Langan - Wells Fargo Adam Jonas - Morgan Stanley Operator Good afternoon, everyone, and welcome to Tesla's First Quarter 2025 Q&A Webcast. title: Tesla Stock: Robotaxi Was A Poor Catalyst
